data.title: redo [Ctrl+y] does not auto repeat in script editor

official 2.1-beta 20160721

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When you keep pressing [Ctrl+Z] to undo, it has key-repeat.

When you keep pressing [Ctrl+Y] to redo, key-repeat does not work, and you have to release and press [Ctrl+Y] several time.

data.title: Fix #5854 (get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos() strange behavior)
data.body:
Fix for incorrect velocity report due to a typo.
Closes  #5854

data.title: get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos() strange behavior (3D)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64 bits (built on commit 6072eb8 the commit is just for reference and is unrelated with the issue)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos() returns inconsistent data.
It seems to happen when a RigidBody hits hard something.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- download the example
- open it in the editor
- run it making sure to have collision shapes visible

you will see on the left side, a body that falls from a lower height, it will show (0,0,0).
on the right side, the body will fall from a higher place, and you will see the issue in the vector being printed.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://www.dropbox.com/s/rsd8vd6j8e3t81t/physbug.zip?dl=0

data.title: ColorPickerButton - pick color from screen does not work
data.body:
There is a tiny pipette button in the pick color dialogue which I assume should let you pick any color from the screen. It however doesnt do anything.

This affects both godot's editor and also using the colorPickerButton node.

To reproduce this:
1. add a colorPickerButton to an empty project or click on such a button somewhere in godot itself
2. Click on the top right pipette button
3. Click anywhere outside of the color picker dialogue - anywhere on the screen

Expected behaviour:

> Mariano Suligoy: Clickng in the screen will pick the color, but also close the color picker

Current behaviour:
Nothing happens. No color is picked and the color picker is closed

tested on both windows and linux - broken on both

data.title: Include random number generators for probability distributions to GDScript
data.body:
Now we can generate numbers from discrete uniform distribution (`randi`) and from continuous uniform distribution (`randf`). What about to include generator for other distributions? - http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/random/

Having _normal, exponential, Poisson, binomial, Bernoulli_ can be quite useful. Of course that random number from all these distribution can be generated from an uniform distribution but algorithms  usually have high time complexity.

data.title: Fix typo in ScrollContainer documentation
Exports With Latest Android Export Templates Crashes At Startup
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10. Latest from GitHub.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Compiled the Android export templates from the latest GitHub source. Exported a game to Android, ran it on an Android device. Crashed at startup.

adb logcat -s godot gives:

https://gist.github.com/ranmaru90/6e516006dd84c2f64c68f1911543adbb

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Get the latest Godot source.
2. `scons platform=android target=release_debug tools=no android_arch=armv6 android_neon=no -j 2 && scons platform=android target=release tools=no android_arch=armv6 android_neon=no -j 2`
3. Go to platform/android/java and `gradlew build`.
4. Export a game using the generated templates in bin.
5. Install and run the game on an Android device.
6. Crashes at startup.

data.title: SurfaceTool add_index method exposed to scripts.
data.body: Expose method to allow indices in the SurfaceTool class to be added manually.

data.title: The game crashes on GDScript error
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4 and 2.1 beta, Windows 10 64 bits

Under a specific error situation, the game crashes when I debug it from the editor. I can still get the script error, however the game is no longer running and the "program stopped working" window appears.
I expected the error to occur and see the debugger pause the execution, not the game to crash.

I simplified my project to the point I can't tell what is causing the error: I just see that if I disable one of two lines in the script, Godot no longer crashes.
[ScriptErrorCrash.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/377191/ScriptErrorCrash.zip)
Open the project and run it, crash.
Now comment one of the indicated lines in terrain.gd, run again: no crash.

Both versions of Godot say this in the simplified project:

```
shit?: No error
ERROR: StreamPeerWinsock::read: Server disconnected!
   At: platform\windows\stream_peer_winsock.cpp:210
```

In the full project, this error occurs just before, maybe it's related:

```
ERROR: PacketPeerStream::put_packet: Condition ' p_buffer_size+4 > temp_buffer.size() ' is true. returned: ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER
   At: core\io\packet_peer.cpp:228
```

data.title: Expose virtual keyboard functions to GDScript
data.body:
Fixes #2126.
I'm not 100% sure of the example use of the existing_text parameter of the show_virtual_keyboard function I gave in the description, as it was really the only thing I could think of to justify this parameter. It works though, so I thought it should be exposed to GDScript too.

data.title: Show progress hint in the task bar
data.body:
As stated in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/5560#issuecomment-231595959

![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/17034435/11257848-4f59-11e6-9fd7-9ea40a682628.gif)

I was able to make this work on Windows. For OSX there's [NSProgressIndicator](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Cocoa/Reference/ApplicationKit/Classes/NSProgressIndicator_Class).

What I'm not sure is what should be the API for this though. I want to be able to set a `ProgressBar` or `TextureProgress` as "default" and make that show in the hint. Still, there's a need to enable/disable the hint at some point, as the OS API doesn't handle that automatically.

For Windows there's also error and pause states, I'm not sure if other OSes can handle that.

data.title: Particle2D Gives Strange Values and inConsistent Format on Inspector
data.body:
- Win 7, Win 10 x64
- Godot 2.1beta

*_Issue description : *_

=> Happened : Strange Values and InConsistent Format on Particles2D node's Parameter Modifier.
[ Let's Modify Some Params values ]

a.) Spread --> type "180" --> 179.999996 displayed --> Now, type "22.3" --> Increase the value using up arrow until "22.5" --> Seeing some weird values and inconsistent format, right?
b.) Linear Velocity --> type "60" --> 59.999999 displayed --> Now, type "22.3" --> Increase the value using up arrow until "22.5" --> Seeing some weird values and inconsistent format, right?

=> Expected : It should be clear. When I put "180", then Editor should say "180". And the format should be consistent, if max decimal places allowed was 2, then the editor should cap the value to max 2 decimal place.

*_Steps to reproduce : *_
- Just do as described on the "Happened" section above.

*_Link to minimal example project : *_
- None

data.title: Extraordinary number of drawcalls with labels contain lots of characters
data.body:
Draw an label control with 1000 of characters would be consume more than 1000 draw call(s) in current version of godot engine, every character consume an draw-call, and other control like Sprite9Frame consume 9 draw-calls
perhaps add sprite-batcher optimization for canvas_item draw can fix this problem.

Fixes mismatch between division and module. Now "double" is in both operations.
("Math" class' functions use "double".)

data.title: "No such file or directory" when including cstdlib when building with android_stl=yes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 14.04 LTS - Godot commit 79a7473

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When building my module in Linux, Windows, etc, I do not have build issues. However when building on Android with android_stl=yes. I get a "No such file or directory" error when including cstdlib.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a module in Godot that contains the line `#include <cstdlib>`
Build the android version of Godot: `scons -j4 platform=android android_stl=yes target=release_debug`

FWIW, in platform/android/detect.py there is a reference to `if (env['android_stl']=='yes'):`. The paths in that block still reference "4.8". I checked on ndk r11c and r12b and it looks like that path doesn't exist anymore. Updating them to "4.9" (to match the paths in the "else" case) seems to fix this issue.

data.title: Remove "SMOOTH BEGIN" print in SurfaceTool
data.body:
There is a print in SurfaceTool that floods the console when we use `generate_normals()`:

```
SMOOTH BEGIN? 0
SMOOTH BEGIN? 0
SMOOTH BEGIN? 0
SMOOTH BEGIN? 0
SMOOTH BEGIN? 0
```

I am making a tool that updates geometry in real time, and this is really slowing it.

data.title: Fix the rotation not updating in the inspector with Controls
data.body: Fixes #5809

data.title: Godot debugging is very slow without Internet
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.4, Windows 10 64 bits

For a long amount of time today I had no internet connection (I had WiFi but there was no internet).
When I launch a game with Godot in that case, it takes a lot longer to start. Sometimes I even thought it was frozen, but after waiting between 8 to 30 seconds, my little test game starts. But in the meantime it looks like Godot is stuck.

I don't see a reason why Internet access should slow down the editor. Debugging uses the network for sure but since it's local I didn't expected that slowdown Oo

data.title: Escaping special characters in RegEx breaks it
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux - c83aa5f86383bf89871f0a41752f5c6eeb148950

**Issue description**
https://godotengine.org/qa/6247/regex-string-literal
Basically, I can't use regex because of special characters. Escaping them renders the regex useless.

**Steps to reproduce:**

``` gdscript
var text = "test123"
var regex = RegEx.new()
regex.compile("/\\d+/g")
regex.find(text)
print(text.get_captures()) # => []
```

**What I expected**
https://regex101.com/r/kF6hC9/1
